channel.title: Politics – Baraza
channel.description: Critical Collaboration on the Middle East, South Asia, and Africa

item.title: Game-Changer: The Rise and Expansion of the Global University
item.dc:creator: Bradley Williams
item.description: There is a de facto 21st century gold rush among elite universities in the United States. In the age of globalized capital, privatization of the state, and commodified education, top-ranked, private universities and colleges are expanding beyond U.S. borders and building proxy campuses in locations fundamental to American economic and military interests. Of the U.S. … Continue reading Game-Changer: The Rise and Expansion of the Global University →

item.title: The Electoral Hawa
item.dc:creator: Vivek Yadav
item.description: Election results in India are not merely an aggregate of atomistic decisions made on the polling day. Even before the first vote is cast, a significant degree of synchronization has usually already taken place in the voting choices of the vast majority of the electorate. One of two scenarios usually obtains. Either a candidate wins … Continue reading The Electoral Hawa →

item.title: Imperial Flush: Crane Co. Valves in Yemen and Saudi Arabia
item.dc:creator: Cristina Violante
item.description: In America today, showering daily is a social norm. We avoid body odor, grease, and sweat, and consider such qualities unhygienic or “gross.” We also consider the technologies behind the daily shower – bathrooms, sewers, and heating systems – and the parts that construct them – valves and pipes – to be commonplace. Their omnipresence … Continue reading Imperial Flush: Crane Co. Valves in Yemen and Saudi Arabia →

item.title: Bullet Films
item.dc:creator: Joscelyn Jurich
item.description: An uncomfortably intimate close-up of a young man’s face opens one of the most recent “bullet films” by Syrian film collective Abounaddara entitled “Don’t Forget the Plums.” The penetrating eyes of the unnamed speaker confront the viewer as he gives cautionary advice about how to deal with the media: “When you’re live on air, the … Continue reading Bullet Films →

item.title: Abdilatif Abdalla: Poet and Political Activist
item.dc:creator: Kai Kresse
item.description: Abdilatif Abdalla, who will be visiting MESAAS and the Institute of African Studies at Columbia on November 12th and 13th, is one of the most renowned living Swahili poets. Mixing poetry and politics has been a feature of Swahili society for a long time, and classic historical Swahili poets, like Fumo Liyongo and Muyaka bin … Continue reading Abdilatif Abdalla: Poet and Political Activist →
